text: noob here. I want to dev someone else’s package but the “dev” function/command does not seem to be available from the REPL. It is also not part of the Pkg Package. Of course, when I run try to run their code `julia path/to/their/file.jl` I guess a package not installed error. Would someone point me to TFM? The best I could find is <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QVmU29rCjaA> starting at around 49:00.

attachments.title: Developing Julia Packages
attachments.video_html: <iframe width="400" height="225" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QVmU29rCjaA?feature=oembed&autoplay=1&iv_load_policy=3" frameborder="0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; clipboard-write; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

elements.text: noob here. I want to dev someone else’s package but the “dev” function/command does not seem to be available from the REPL. It is also not part of the Pkg Package. Of course, when I run try to run their code
I guess a package not installed error. Would someone point me to TFM? The best I could find is

text:
What does TFM mean?

> I want to dev someone else’s package but the “dev” function/command does not seem to be available from the REPL. 
You can enter the package REPL mode by typing `]`, then `dev` should be available

elements.text: I want to dev someone else’s package but the “dev” function/command does not seem to be available from the REPL.
You can enter the package REPL mode by typing

text:
> What does TFM mean?
My attempt to be self-effacing. “T Fing Manual” c.f. RTFM.

elements.text: My attempt to be self-effacing. “T Fing Manual” c.f. RTFM.

text:
> You can enter the package REPL mode by typing `]`, then `dev` should be available
Wow! This is incredible!

elements.text: You can enter the package REPL mode by typing

text:
Here's tfm in that case: :smile: <https://pkgdocs.julialang.org/v1/getting-started/>

There's also `;` to enter shell mode, and `?` for help mode, and `Ctrl R` (might be Cmd on macos?) to search through your repl history

elements.text: (might be Cmd on macos?) to search through your repl history

text: Wonderful, that’s what I needed. Why didn’t I find it? Sigh. Thanks for the pointer! These repl modes are amazing.

elements.text: Wonderful, that’s what I needed. Why didn’t I find it? Sigh. Thanks for the pointer! These repl modes are amazing.
